page.title: 02ATTITUDES TO CHANGE FLECKNEY
page.content: ATTITUDES TO CHANGE,FLECKNEY These are some of the brief attitudes to change some elderly residents of Fleckney hold. A.Impressions of the past. 1)There were less houses 2)There were more small shops (no supermarkets) 3)Everyone knew each other, it was a friendly place B.Changes for the better. There have been improvement to shopping,children's, medical, transport, library and lighting facilities as well as housing. C.Changes for the worse. The village has grown too large, the roads are insufficent, the village is dirtier with too much vandalism. D.Is life better now? The general view was that inspite of the improvements life was not better.
